Package fate.core.ControlImplementations

Class CoreMouseControl

java.lang.Object
fate.core.ControlImplementations.CoreMouseControl
public class CoreMouseControl extends Object
Handles the mouse for UI tests

  • Method Details

    • dragAndDrop

      public void dragAndDrop(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement sourceElement, org.openqa.selenium.WebElement targetElement)
      A method that performs click-and-hold at the location of the source element, moves to the location of the target element, then releases the mouse.
      Parameters:
      sourceElement - Element to drag.
      targetElement - Element where to drop sourceElement.

    • scrollByWheel

      public void scrollByWheel(int deltaX, int deltaY)
      Scrolls by provided amounts with the origin in the top left corner of the viewport.
      Parameters:
      deltaX - The distance along X axis to scroll using the wheel. A negative value scrolls left.
      deltaY - The distance along Y axis to scroll using the wheel. A negative value scrolls up.

    • dragAndDrop

      public void dragAndDrop(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element, int xOfDragLoc, int yOfDragLoc, int xOfDropLoc, int yOfDropLoc)
      A method that performs click-and-hold at the location midpoint in addition to the drag offset values, then moves the element by the drop offset values and finally releases the mouse. Note: offset positive value of xOffset means that the mouse moves to right direction and the negative value means that the mouse moves to left direction and the same for yOffset, positive value means mouse moves down and negative value means that mouse moves up.
      Parameters:
      element - Web element
      xOfDragLoc - xOffset value to shift the element's drag x coordinate
      yOfDragLoc - yOffset value to shift the element's drag y coordinate
      xOfDropLoc - xOffset value to move the element to it horizontally
      yOfDropLoc - yOffset value to move the element to it vertically

    • dragAndDrop

      public void dragAndDrop(org.openqa.selenium.By sourceElement, org.openqa.selenium.By targetElement)
      A method that performs click-and-hold at the location of the source element, moves to the location of the target element, then releases the mouse.
      Parameters:
      sourceElement - Element selector to drag.
      targetElement - Element selector where to drop sourceElement.

    • dragAndDropByOffset

      public void dragAndDropByOffset(org.openqa.selenium.By sourceElement, int x, int y)
      A method that performs click-and-hold at the location of the source element, moves to the location of the offset, then releases the mouse.
      Parameters:
      sourceElement - Element selector to drag.

    • dragAndDrop

      public void dragAndDrop(org.openqa.selenium.Point sourceCoords, org.openqa.selenium.Point targetCoords)

      Parameters:
      sourceCoords - source coordinates.
      targetCoords - target coordinates.

      public void moveToCoordinates(int x, int y, Boolean... arg)
      Moves mouse cursor to wanted coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - x coord
      y - y coord
      arg - true, for mouse click after movement.

      Parameters:
      ctrlToMove - as WebElement object
      sub - Wanted sub element inside wanted control.

    • scrollWheel

      public void scrollWheel(int x, int y, int wheelAmount)
      Scroll mouse wheel over a specific point to zoom in and out
      Parameters:
      x - int value of the webElement centre
      y - int value of the webElement centre
      wheelAmount - the value of wheel movement (positive zoom in and negative value for zoom out)

    • clickAndHold

      public void clickAndHold(@Nonnull org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element, @Nonnull Duration duration)
      Clicks and holds left mouse button pressed in the middle of the provided element for specified duration time.
